name: Record
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud DNS.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/dns.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var dns = gcloud.dns();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var dns = gcloud.dns({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

params.name: metadata.data
params.description: • Defined in RFC 1035, section 5 and RFC 1034, section 3.6.1.

params.name: metadata.ttl
params.description: • Seconds that the resource is cached by resolvers.

methods.name: delete
methods.description:
Delete this record by creating a change on your zone. This is a convenience method for:

zone.createChange({ delete: record }, function(err, change, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.
